citations.narrative:
Two metal bird-cage style enclosures housing 1 and 3 common marmoset had rusted bars and surfaces that were flaking
and pitted, and could not be adequately sanitized. Flaking, rusted surfaces may harbor bacteria or mold, and may become
a source of contamination or have an adverse effect on animal welfare if ingested or picked at. The facility must ensure
that surfaces of housing facilities are free of excessive rust that may affect structural integrity and prevent adequate
cleaning and sanitation.
Correct by May 1, 2025.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Enclosures 8 and 9 housing 1 common marmoset each had an accumulation of debris on the feeding station and feces on
the floor outside the cage. The 2 bird-cage style enclosures housing 1 and 3 common marmosets have a buildup of food
and waste in the trays and on the floor surrounding the cages. The facility representative stated that the bird-cage style
enclosures were "cleaned about a month ago." Excessive build up of feces and food waste can be a disease hazard and
attract unwanted pests. Excreta and food waste must be spot cleaned with sufficient frequency to ensure all animals the
freedom to avoid contact with excreta or as often as necessary to reduce disease hazards, insects, pests and odors.
Correct by April 9, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.75(c)(1)(i) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
Two metal bird-cage style enclosures housing 1 and 3 common marmoset had rusted bars and surfaces that were flaking 
and pitted, and could not be adequately sanitized. Flaking, rusted surfaces may harbor bacteria or mold, and may become 
a source of contamination or have an adverse effect on animal welfare if ingested or picked at. The facility must ensure 
that surfaces of housing facilities are free of excessive rust that may affect structural integrity and prevent adequate 
cleaning and sanitation. 
 
Correct by May 1, 2025. 
3.84(a) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Enclosures 8 and 9 housing 1 common marmoset each had an accumulation of debris on the feeding station and feces on 
the floor outside the cage. The 2 bird-cage style enclosures housing 1 and 3 common marmosets have a buildup of food 
and waste in the trays and on the floor surrounding the cages. The facility representative stated that the bird-cage style 
enclosures were "cleaned about a month ago." Excessive build up of feces and food waste can be a disease hazard and 
attract unwanted pests. Excreta and food waste must be spot cleaned with sufficient frequency to ensure all animals the 
freedom to avoid contact with excreta or as often as necessary to reduce disease hazards, insects, pests and odors. 
 
Correct by April 9, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
